headline: Senate Is Set to Pass a Stablecoin Bill. Rules for Crypto Exchanges Will Be Harder.
summary: Its next goal—legislation regulating exchanges and token issuers—might be a steeper hill to climb.  As soon as Monday, the Senate plans to hold a key procedural vote on the so-called GENIUS Act.  Issuers would also have to follow anti-money-laundering and terrorism finance rules and to give coin holders priority to recoup their money in a bankruptcy.

raw.headline: Senate Is Set to Pass a Stablecoin Bill. Rules for Crypto Exchanges Will Be Harder.
raw.summary: Its next goal—legislation regulating exchanges and token issuers—might be a steeper hill to climb.  As soon as Monday, the Senate plans to hold a key procedural vote on the so-called GENIUS Act.  Issuers would also have to follow anti-money-laundering and terrorism finance rules and to give coin holders priority to recoup their money in a bankruptcy.

headline: Coinbase's dizzying week before S&P 500 debut: What happened?
summary: Coinbase (COIN) started the week announcing its upcoming debut on the S&P 500 (^GSPC), but it quickly soured after news of a major cybersecurity breach and an ongoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) investigation. Mark Palmer, Benchmark Company managing director and senior research analyst of fintech and digital assets, joins Asking for a Trend to explain what happened. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: The Score: UnitedHealth, Walmart, Coinbase Global and More Stocks That Moved on the Week’s News
summary: UnitedHealth  suffered a stock meltdown this past week.  The Justice Department is investigating the healthcare conglomerate—and parent of insurance giant UnitedHealthcare—for possible criminal Medicare fraud, The Wall Street Journal reported late Wednesday.  The criminal probe adds to a list of government inquiries into UnitedHealth, including antitrust investigations and a civil investigation of its Medicare billing practices that The Wall Street Journal first reported in February.

headline: Bitcoin holds, gold falls, Coinbase rebounds from SEC pressure
summary: Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) holds near $104,000, remaining steady this week as improving geopolitical conditions give the cryptocurrency a boost. Gold (GC=F) pulls back on Ukraine–Russia peace talks and US–China trade progress. Coinbase (COIN) stock rebounds after previous losses caused by pressure from a US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) investigation into past user metrics. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Coinbase Stock Is Bouncing Back. What Analysts Are Saying After Thursday’s Bad News.
summary: There are no two ways about it:  Coinbase Global  had a nasty day on Thursday.  First, news broke that  Coinbase  and tens of thousands of users were victims of a data breach that could cost the company up to $400 million.  Coinbase shares closed down 7.2%, just days after the stock boomed due to its inclusion in the  But Coinbase was climbing again Friday, with a gain of 7.8% to $263.60.

headline: Meet the Newest Stock in the S&P 500: It Has Soared 640% Since 2023 and Is Still a Buy in 2025, According to Certain Wall Street Analysts
summary: Coinbase Global on May 19 will be added to the S&P 500, an index commonly viewed as the single best gauge for the entire U.S. stock market.  Following inclusion in the S&P 500, companies have historically seen their shares prices increase by an average of 12% during the next year.  Coinbase runs the largest U.S. cryptocurrency spot exchange, and the company will acquire the world’s largest cryptocurrency options exchange Deribit.
